alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 9:44PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Henderson and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Dubuque, Jo Daviess and Jackson Counties. Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Lee, Des Moines, Hancock and Henderson Counties. Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Scott, Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Dubuque and Jo Daviess Counties. Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Louisa, Henderson, Des Moines and Mercer Counties. Mississippi River at New Boston LD17 affecting Louisa and Mercer Counties. Mississippi River at Muscatine affecting Louisa, Mercer, Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Whiteside, Scott, Clinton and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12 affecting Jo Daviess, Carroll, Clinton and Jackson Counties. Mississippi River at Fulton LD13 affecting Whiteside, Carroll and Clinton Counties. Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Scott and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16 affecting Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. .Melting snowpack in the upper Midwest will increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is expected in the next 7 days * WHERE...Mississippi River at Muscatine. * WHEN...From Thursday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, water affects most of the Riverside Park parking lot. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Monday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday evening and continue rising to 18.5 feet Monday morning. Rises are expected to continue until at least the end of April. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 09/24/1938. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon.
